com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.layers
Class GraphicLayer

java.lang.Object
  com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.layers.FLyrDefault
      com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.layers.GraphicLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
FLayer, LayerListener, Projected
public class GraphicLayer
extends FLyrDefault

GraphicLayer represents a layer with graphical items, that are geometries with a symbol and handlers associated.

The internal graphical items are independent to each other and can be selected separately. There is a bit set to define which item are selected. They, will be drawn with handlers, that according to the particular implementation of each one, can allow user to move, center, deform, ... each graphical item.

See Also:
FLyrDefault

process

public void process(com.vividsolutions.jts.index.ItemVisitor visitor,
                    Cancellable cancel)

Processes all graphic items of this layer according to the visitor pattern. This operation can be canceled at any time.

Parameters:
visitor - object that allows visit each graphic item
cancel - shared object that determines if this layer can continue being drawn

cancel - an object thread that implements the Cancellable interface, and will allow to cancel the draw
scale - the scale of the view. Must be between FLayer.getMinScale() and FLayer.getMaxScale().
properties - a set with the settings to be applied to a whole print job and to all the docs in the print job

addGraphic

public void addGraphic(FGraphic g)

Adds a new graphic item to the graphic layer, and, if success, sets as new extent the graphic's one if this layer hadn't, otherwise sets as new extent the union of both.

Parameters:
g - the new graphic item
See Also:
insertGraphic(int, FGraphic), inserGraphics(int, Collection)

insertGraphic

public void insertGraphic(int position,
                          FGraphic g)

Adds a new graphic item to the graphic layer at the position specified of the internal list, and, if success, sets as new extent the graphic's one if this layer hadn't, otherwise sets as new extent the union of both.

Parameters:
position - the index of the element to insert
g - the new graphic item
See Also:
inserGraphics(int, Collection), addGraphic(FGraphic)

clearAllGraphics

public void clearAllGraphics()
Removes all graphic items from this layer. The internal list of graphic items will be empty after this call returns, and layer won't have extent.

See Also:
removeGraphic(FGraphic), removeGraphic(int)

clearSymbolsGraphics

public void clearSymbolsGraphics()
Removes all symbols from this layer. The internal list of symbols will be empty after this call returns.

See Also:
addSymbol(ISymbol)

getSelection

public FBitSet getSelection()

Gets a set of boolean values that specifies which graphic items of this layer are selected.

Returns:
a set of boolean values. Each value is equal to true if is selected the graphic item that has the same position in the internal list of graphic items of this layer, and to false if isn't selected
See Also:
setSelection(FBitSet)

setSelection

public void setSelection(FBitSet selection)

Sets a set of boolean values that specifies which graphic items of this layer are selected.

Parameters:
selection - a set of boolean values. Each value is equal to true if is selected the graphic item that has the same position in the internal list of graphic items of this layer, and to false if isn't selected
See Also:
getSelection()

queryByRect

public FBitSet queryByRect(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D r)
Returns a bit set that reports which graphic items (geometries), intersect with the rectangle r.

Parameters:
r - the Rectangle2D to be intersected with some geometries of this layer
Returns:
a FBitSet which true bits represent the geometries of this layer that intersect with the rectangle
See Also:

getNumGraphics

public int getNumGraphics()
Returns the number of graphic items in this layer.

Returns:
the number of graphic items in this list
See Also:
addGraphic(FGraphic), inserGraphics(int, Collection), insertGraphic(int, FGraphic), clearAllGraphics(), removeGraphic(FGraphic), removeGraphic(int), getGraphic(int)

inserGraphics

public void inserGraphics(int index,
                          java.util.Collection c)

Inserts all of the elements in the specified Collection into the internal list of graphic items, starting at the specified position. Shifts the element currently at that position (if there was any) and any subsequent elements to the right (increasing their indices). The new elements will appear in the list in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator.

Parameters:
index - index where starting to insert the elements from the specified collection
c - elements to be inserted into this list
See Also:
insertGraphic(int, FGraphic), addGraphic(FGraphic)

removeGraphic

public void removeGraphic(int graphicIndex)

Fast remove: removes only a graphic item of this layer.

Remember to call reCalculateFullExtent() when you finish removing graphics.

Parameters:
graphicIndex - the graphic item to be removed
See Also:
removeGraphic(FGraphic), clearAllGraphics()

getSymbol

public int getSymbol(ISymbol sym)

Searches for the first symbol sym, testing for equality using the equals method.

Parameters:
sym - a symbol
Returns:
the index of the first occurrence of sym; returns -1 if the object is not found.
